translated: As It Was Said
The Collection of Groups of Ones
The Third Section
With a Clear Mind

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Idhāhaṁ, bhikkhave, ekaccaṁ puggalaṁ pasannacittaṁ evaṁ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
analyzed: idha aha bhikkhave ekaccam puggalam pasanna cittam evam cetasā cetaḥ paricca pajānāmi
translated: “Monks, by encompassing mind with mind I understand a certain person thus:

original: ‘imamhi cāyaṁ samaye puggalo kālaṁ kareyya yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ sagge’.
analyzed: imamhi ca ayam samaye puggalo kālam kareyya yathābhatam nikkhittaḥ evam sagge
translated: ‘If this person were to die at this time, then as if he were to be carried off, he would be placed in heaven.’
Why is that?
Because his mind is clear.

original: Cetopasādahetu kho pana, bhikkhave, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: cetaḥ upasāda hetu kho pana bhikkhave evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: It is because of the clarity of mind that some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, in a heavenly world.”
The Blessed One said this.

analyzed: tattha itam iti vuccati  pasanna cittam ñatvāna
